page.title: 18Ravensworth Village Hall
page.content: The{Village Hall}ceased to be a school in June 1967 and for the next 18 years it remained the property of the{Parish {Church.}The W.I.held monthly meetings and a few parish functions took place in the hall. It was finally purchased by The{Parish Council}who leased it to the{Village Hall Committee,}who paid for the renovations by organising fund raising events. It was converted by the villagers and{Swale Construction} builders. The names of everyone who helped are on a plaque on the wall inside the hall.A{clock}was presented to the{"Old School"}at a ceremony in the in the new school hall on 18th March 1985 attended by pupils of the present school together with scholars from the original school.The hall is used by the{W.I.,Youth Club}for dances and let for private functions.Manpower Services have built a quoits court.
